duties_responsibilities.duty: Maintains and supports the corporate network, including troubleshooting network performance issues, and routine maintenance of servers, computers, printers, and other technology infrastructure.
Acts as the first-level support and central contact for issues received via the ticketing system, emails, walk-ins, and/or telephone inquiries from the user community.
Provides application and hardware help desk support, ensuring technology users receive exceptional service or help with their questions and concerns.
Configures, supports, and maintains the corporate network, servers, and email, emphasizing security, integrity, and recoverability.
Monitors network performance, health, and capacity and implements necessary adjustments to ensure optimal functionality and reliability.
Maintains an accurate hardware/software inventory for all relevant IT-managed networking hardware/software.
Researches and resolves problems and issues, ensuring network security by implementing and maintaining appropriate access controls, firewalls, and intrusion detection systems.
Maintains level 1 support of electronic access control and network-connected camera systems for all locations.
Maintains and supports audio/visual and teleconference systems, as well as telecom/VOIP hardware/software.
Conducts all business in accordance with company policies and procedures, and appropriate government laws and regulations.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's preferred)
